intro: Oxylobus subglabrus, commonly known as the smooth oxylobus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and often have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Oxylobus subglabrus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
